Text: 10 Altresponse Actually alternate response means that if A occurs then B must eventually occur after A and no other event of type B can occur in between Actually the standard definition AltResponse A B means that if A occurs then B must eventually occur after A and no other A can occur before B I need to recall DECLARE semantics Typically alternate response means that each time A occurs it must be followed by B and there cannot be another A occurring before the next B So it enforces a strict alternating pattern of A then B with no A in between But here the constraint is given with source and target TransferFunds source and NotifyCustomer target So it means that every occurrence of TransferFunds must eventually be followed by an occurrence of NotifyCustomer and no other TransferFunds can occur in between so its a onetoone alternation

Text: 11 Altprecedence each time B occurs it must be preceded by A and there cannot be another B occurring after A before this B So it enforces that A and B alternate with A before B 12 Altsuccession it combines alternate response and alternate precedence so they must alternate strictly 13 Chainresponse if A occurs then B must occur immediately after next event So AssembleLoanOfferPackage must be immediately followed by TransferFunds 14 Chainprecedence Before AuthorizeContractTerms the immediately preceding event must be PreliminaryCreditCheck 15 Chainsuccession if A occurs then B must occur immediately after and if B occurs then A must have occurred immediately before So its a strict immediate succession
